newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-SAMPDORIA STAY IN FRAME FOR CHAMPIONS' LEAGUE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SAMPDORIA STAY IN FRAME FOR CHAMPIONS' LEAGUE.

text.p: Prolific young striker Vincenzo Montella scored twice as Sampdoria beat Reggiana 3-0 on Sunday to stay in the hunt for a place in next season's European Cup Champions' League.

Montella's fifth minute header and 68th minute penalty against the bottom club in serie A took his tally for the season to 16 goals in 17 matches and clinched Sampdoria's first league win since defeating Milan on February 2.
The Genoa club leap-frog over Inter into third place, four points behind Parma and the runners-up spot that guarantees qualification for the Champions' League.
Serie A leaders Juventus remain a cut above the rest - five points clear of Parma - following their 3-0 thrashing of Roma in a match played on Saturday in Turin.

Inter, beaten by Enrico Chiesa's goal at Parma in another match played on Saturday, drop to fourth, a point behind Sampdoria and level with Bologna, 2-1 winners at home to Italian Cup finalists Napoli.
Cagliari, fourth from bottom, fought back from a goal down to defeat Vicenza with a second-half goal from Sandro Tovalieri that kept alive their hopes of avoiding relegation.
